tuv.seg: The European Commission is based in Brussels in Belgium
Tá Coimisiún na hEorpa bunaithe sa Bhruiséal, sa Bheilg
It also has offices in Luxembourg, representations in all EU countries and delegations in many capital cities around the world
Tá oifigí ag an gCoimisiún freisin sa Lucsamburg; ionadaíocht i ngach tír den AE agus toscaireachtaí i go leor príomhchathracha ar fud an domhain
It is made up of 28 Commissioners, one from each Member State
Tá 28 Coimisinéirí air, ceann ó gach Ballstát
The Commission has a number of important functions:
Tá roinnt feidhmeanna tábhachtacha ag an gCoimisiún:
• The Commission initiates legislation
• Cuireann an Coimisiún tús le reachtaíocht
It makes proposals for European laws, which are sent to the Council and European Parliament for amendment and approval
Déanann sé moltaí do Dhlíthe na hEorpa, a cuirtear chuig an gComhairle agus chuig Parlaimint na hEorpa le leasú agus le ceadú
• The Commission acts as a guardian of the EU treaties
• Feidhmníonn an Coimisiún mar choimirceoir conarthaí an AE
It ensures that EU legislation is applied by all Member States
Déanann sé cinnte go bhfuil reachtaíocht an AE curtha i bhfeidhm i ngach Ballstát
It can institute proceedings against Member States or businesses that fail to comply with EU law
Is féidir leis an dlí a chur ar Bhallstáit nó ar ghnónna nach gcloíann le dlí na hEorpa
• The Commission acts as an executive body - it manages policies and the annual budget
• Údarás feidhmiúcháin atá ann - déanann sé bainistiú ar pholasaithe agus ar an mbuiséad bliantúil
• The Commission represents the EU on the international stage
• Déanann an Coimisiún ionadaíocht ar son an AE go hidirnáisiúnta
It negotiates trade and co-operation agreements with non-EU countries
Tugann sé i gcrích comhaontuithe trádála agus comhoibrithe le tíortha taobh amuigh den AE
The President of the Commission is nominated by common agreement of the Governments of the Member States after consultation with the European Parliament
Aontaíonn Rialtais na mBallstát ar dhuine le n-ainmniú mar Uachtarán an Choimisiúin tar éis dul i gcomhairle le Parlaimint na hEorpa
Once the President is nominated, the other members of the Commission are selected and agreed
Nuair atá an tUachtarán ainmnithe, déantar baill eile an Choimisiúin a roghnú agus a aontú
In practice, the Government of each Member State nominates a Commissioner according to its own selection procedure
I ndáiríre, ainmníonn Rialtas gach Ballstáit Coimisinéir ag brath ar a chóras roghnaithe féin
This means that the Commission reflects a variety of talents and vocations such as politicians, lawyers, civil servants and academics
Mar sin bíonn éagsúlacht taithí agus gairmeacha sa Choimisiún, polaiteoirí, dlíodóirí, státseirbhísigh agus daoine acadúla
The Parliament must then vote to approve the appointment of the President and the other members of the Commission
Ní mór ansin don Pharlaimint vóta a chaitheamh le ceapachán an Uachtaráin agus baill eile an Choimisiúin a cheadú
If the Parliament should refuse to appoint one or more of the Commissioners, the selection process must start again
Dá dtarlódh sé gur dhiúltaigh an Pharlaimint duine nó níos mó de na Coimisinéirí a cheapadh, ní mór don chóras roghnaithe tosú arís
Members of the Commission are appointed for a renewable term of 5 years
Déantar baill an Choimisiúin a cheapadh ar feadh tréimhse inathnuaite de 5 bliana
The current Commission will be in office from 2014 to 2019
Mairfidh téarma oifige an Choimisiúin ó 2014 go dtí 2019
The President of the Commission is appointed for a renewable 5 year term
Déantar Uachtarán an Choimisiúin a cheapadh ar feadh tréimhse inathnuaite de 5 bliana
Commissioners are given a portfolio which is his/her area of responsibility
Tugtar dualgais do gach coimisinéir

It is up to the President of the Commission to decide which Commissioner will be responsible for each policy area/portfolio and to reshuffle these responsibilities (if necessary) during the Commission's term of office
Is é Uachtarán an Choimisiúin a dhéanann an cinneadh cén cúram a thabharfar do gach Coimisinéir agus más gá atheagrú ar na cúraimí sin i rith téarma oifige an Choimisiúin
Commissioners act independently in the interests of the EU
Bíonn Coimisinéirí ag feidhmiú go néamhspléach ar son leasa an AE
They do not represent the interests of their own Member State
Ní ar son leasa a mBallstát féin a bhíonn siad ag obair
Each Commissioner appoints a cabinet of his/her own choice headed by the chef de cabinet
Ceapann gach Coimisinéir comh-aireacht dá c(h)uid féin le chef de cabinet i gceannas air
The cabinet consists of a small group of counsellors (usually about five) who assist him/her in the preparation of Commission decisions
Grúpa beag comhairleoirí atá sa chomh-aireacht (cúigear go hiondúil) a thugann cúnamh don Choimisinéir cinnithe den Choimisiún a ullmhú
As well as the cabinets, the Commission's personnel is organised into specialist departments called "Directorates General" which are in turn divided into Directorates and then into Units
Chomh maith leis na comh-aireachtaí tá foireann an Choimisinéara eagraithe i rannóga speisialta ar a dtugtar Príomh Stiúrthóireachtaí agus iad sin roinnte ina Stiúrthóireachtaí agus ansin ina nAonaid
At the head of each department, there is a Director General responsible to the relevant Commissioner
Ag ceann gach roinn tá Príomh Stiúrthóir atá freagrach don Choimisinéir Cuí
To assist the Commissioners in the performance of their duties, there is a staff of about 23,000 people employed and paid by the Commission
Le cúnamh a chur ar fáil do na Coimisinéirí a ndualgais a chur i gcrích tá foireann oibre timpeall 23,000 fostaithe agus íoctha ag an gCoimisiún
This staff comes from all of the Member States and includes language experts, lawyers, experts in particular fields such as agriculture or industry and administrative staff

Is as na Ballstáit ar fad a thagann an fhoireann oibre seo agus ina measc tá saineolaithe teanga, dlíodóirí, saineolaithe i réimsí faoi leith - mar shampla talmhaíocht nó tionscal - agus foireann riaracháin
The entire Commission may be forced to resign en masse by the European Parliament
Is féidir le Parlaimint na hEorpa iachall a chur ar an gCoimisiún ina iomlán éirí as oifig
Two-thirds of the votes cast and at least half of the MEPs must pass a motion of censure of the Commission
Ní mór do dhá-thrian de na vótaí caite agus ar a laghad ½ de na Feisirí Eorpacha aontú le rún cáinte i dtaobh an Choimisiúin
The Commission meets once a week to adopt proposals, finalise policy papers and make decisions. Decisions are taken by a simple majority vote
Bíonn cruinniú uair amháin sa tseachtain ag an gCoimisiún le rúin a mholadh, páipéir pholasaithe a aontú agus le cinnithe a thógáil
Once a decision is taken, it becomes Commission policy and has the full support of all Commissioners
Nuair atá cinneadh tógtha, glactar leis mar pholasaí an Choimisiúin agus bíonn lán-tacaíocht na gCoimisinéirí uilig aige
The European Commission Representation in Ireland offers a public information centre with information on all aspects of Europe
Cuireann Ionadaíocht an Choimisiúin Eorpaigh lárionad eolais poiblí ar fáil le faisnéis faoi gach gné den Eoraip
Further information on the European Commission is available on the Commission's website
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar an gCoimisiún Eorpach le fáil ar shuíomh idirlín an Choimisiúin
